page.title: 17Churches in Chalton
page.content: {St. Michaels}is a 13Century flint building. In the lychgate is a memorial tablet. Inside are also tablets to the families of Clerke-Jeivoise, John Ball and Philip Heberden. (Heberdens is still a farm name). There is an arched piscina and a font that was broken in the Civil war. {St. Huberts}is set in the fields of a deserted village. It is approached, opposite Heberdens farm by a long grass path which has a wooden bridge for times of flooding. The church was built by the father of King Harold and has a Saxon window and quoins. Inside are medieval wall paintings showing scenes from St. Huberts life, including the clieving of a werewolf. There are box pews and a Jacobean pulpit.
